column1: Table 3. Morocco: Budgetary Central Government Finance, 2016–25
Taxes on income, profits, and capital gains             8.3       8.8        8.6      8.5       8.4    7.8     7.7      7.7     7.8    8.0
Taxes on international trade and transactions           0.9       0.8        0.9      0.9       0.8    1.0     0.9      0.9     1.0    1.0
Use of goods and services and grants                      7.2       7.4        7.7      8.3       8.9    8.9     8.6      8.6     8.7    8.9
Of which : Use of goods and services                    2.6       2.6        2.7      2.7       2.6    2.5     2.7      2.7     2.7    2.8
Deposits at the Treasury from third parties                5.5       5.5        5.3      5.2       5.7    5.5     5.3      5.2     5.0    4.8
Sources: Ministry of Economy and Finance; and IMF staff estimates.
1/ Includes transfers to other general government units, international organizations, and foreign governments
2/ Includes supports to households as cash transfers, bus tickets, transportation, etc.
3/ Includes capital transfers to public entities.
4/ Does not include deposits at the Treasury from third parties (SOEs, private entities and individuals).
